summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between a federal prosecutor from the Southern District of New York and attorney Jeff Jocks, representing the Interlochen Center for the Arts. The emails discuss a subpoena for records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, specifically seeking information about tuition payments made by Epstein or his entities for students at Interlochen. The correspondence reveals the investigation's focus on financial connections and the institution's response that no such payment records exist.

connections.description: Jocks, as attorney for Interlochen, is responding to a federal subpoena seeking records related to Epstein's potential financial transactions with the institution.
Jocks is responding to a subpoena that also names Maxwell, indicating a legal and investigative connection.
Both are copied on legal correspondence regarding the Interlochen subpoena, suggesting they are colleagues or co-counsel representing the institution.
Both are named together as subjects of the federal subpoena, indicating they are jointly under investigation.

events.title: Subpoena Issued to Interlochen
events.description: A federal prosecutor serves a subpoena on Interlochen Center for the Arts seeking records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Interlochen's Response on Epstein Payments
events.description: Attorney Jeff Jocks informs prosecutors that Interlochen has no records of tuition payments made by Epstein or his entities, as they only keep such records for 7 years.

events.title: Follow-up Subpoena for Student Records
events.description: A prosecutor sends a follow-up subpoena to Interlochen for additional student records, indicating the investigation is ongoing.

locations: Interlochen Center for the Arts (implied location: Interlochen, Michigan)
Traverse City, Michigan 49684 (Jeff Jocks's law firm address)
New York, NY 10007 (Southern District of New York Office, St. Andrew's Plaza)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issued a subpoena to the Interlochen Center for Arts seeking records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The subpoena specifically sought records of any tuition payments made by Epstein or his entities for students at Interlochen.
Interlochen's attorney, Jeff Jocks, stated the institution had no such payment records, as they only retain tuition payment information for seven years.
The email chain shows a prolonged investigative effort from February 2020 through March 2021, including a follow-up subpoena for additional student records.
The correspondence is marked as confidential, and the prosecutors requested that Interlochen keep the subpoena confidential.
